018package org.opengis.coordinate;
019
020
021/**
022 * Indicates that an operation cannot be completed properly because of a
023 * mismatch in the coordinate reference systems or epoch of components.
024 * For example, this exception may be thrown on attempts to construct
025 * an envelope with lower and upper corners in different <abbr>CRS</abbr>.
026 *
027 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (IRD, Geomatys)
028 * @version 3.1
029 * @since   3.1
030 */
031public class MismatchedCoordinateMetadataException extends IllegalArgumentException {
032    /**
033     * Serial number for inter-operability with different versions.
034     */
035    private static final long serialVersionUID = 6222334569692693273L;
036
037    /**
038     * Creates an exception with no message.
039     */
040    public MismatchedCoordinateMetadataException() {
041    }
042
043    /**
044     * Creates an exception with the specified message.
045     *
046     * @param  message  the detail message. The detail message is saved for
047     *         later retrieval by the {@link #getMessage()} method.
048     */
049    public MismatchedCoordinateMetadataException(String message) {
050        super(message);
051    }
052
053    /**
054     * Creates an exception with the specified message and cause.
055     *
056     * @param  message  the detail message. The detail message is saved for
057     *         later retrieval by the {@link #getMessage()} method.
058     * @param  cause  the cause.
059     */
060    public MismatchedCoordinateMetadataException(String message, Throwable cause) {
061        super(message, cause);
062    }
063}
